intro: Anthyllis depressa, commonly known as the low anthyllis, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches a height of 10–30 centimeters. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom in early spring. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, adapted to thrive in dry, rocky environments. Anthyllis depressa is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal dunes.
